title: Syrian Migration Series #18
description: As conditions in the camps worsened, the migrants tried to leave any way they could. Many were smuggled out, paying enormous sums of money, to the smugglers. They were put on small fishing boats or dinghies. Often these small boats sank under the heavy weight of all the people. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helen_Zughaib
location: Office of the Secretary of State of DC (1350 Penn Ave NW, 419)

title: Syrian Migration Series #18
description: Many people tried to go to Europe and Turkey, seeking refuge from the war.
location: Office of the Secretary of State of DC (1350 Penn Ave NW, 419)

title: Syrian Migration Series #18
description: Make-Shift schools sprung up in the refugee camps, as families struggled to continue their children's education.
location: Office of the Secretary of State of DC (1350 Penn Ave NW, 419)

title: Syrian Migration Series #18
description: People stand together in unity despite isolation and encampment.

title: Pebble Figures
description: When I saw all these families being forced to leave their homes, I felt pain. Why should anyone be forced to leave their home?
location: DC Corrections Information Council (1400 I street NW, 400)

title: N/A
description: A child refugee paints a tent as part of the UNHCR art project in Jordan

title: Untitled
description: A solitary refugee moves through a UN tent camp, symbolizing endurance, memory, and the human cost of forced migration.

title: Unpacked: Refugee Baggage
description: A suitcase opens to reveal a miniature model of a bombed Syrian home. Light spills onto the broken walls and furniture, highlighting the destruction. It represents the homes and memories refugees carry with them.

title: Syrian Migration Series #18
description: Heavy bombing killed thousands of people.

title: The Harrowing Personal Stories of Syrian Refugees, in Their Own Words
